publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-527 Trish Godman: Elderly People and the NHS—That the Parliament commends Age Concern on its recently published report Turning Your Back on Us: Older People and the NHS which deals with the serious problem of age discrimination in the National Health Service; believes that medical treatment and care should not be denied or delayed simply on the basis of age; and urges the Scottish Executive to commission an independent investigation to assess whether age discrimination is practised in the National Health Service and to produce an agenda for action if such discrimination exists.
S1M-527 Elderly People and the NHS (lodged on 9 February 2000) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-527 Trish Godman: Elderly People and the NHS-That the Parliament commends Age Concern on its recently published report Turning Your Back on Us: Older People and the NHS which deals with the serious problem of age discrimination in the National Health Service; believes that medical treatment and care should not be denied or delayed simply on the basis of age; and urges the Scottish Executive to commission an independent investigation to assess whether age discrimination is practised in the National Health Service and to produce an agenda for action if such discrimination exists. Supported by: Mr John McAllion
S1M-527 Elderly People and the NHS (lodged on 9 February 2000) Bristow Muldoon*
S1M-527 Elderly People and the NHS (lodged on 9 February 2000) Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-527 Trish Godman: Elderly People and the NHS—That the Parliament commends Age Concern on its recently published report Turning Your Back on Us: Older People and the NHS which deals with the serious problem of age discrimination in the National Health Service; believes that medical treatment and care should not be denied or delayed simply on the basis of age; and urges the Scottish Executive to commission an independent investigation to assess whether age discrimination is practised in the National Health Service and to produce an agenda for action if such discrimination exists. Supported by: Mr John McAllion, Bristow Muldoon, Cathy Jamieson
S1M-527 Elderly People and the NHS (lodged on 9 February 2000) Mr Jamie Stone*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-527 Elderly People and the NHS (lodged on 9 February 2000) Elaine Smith*

S1M-527 Trish Godman: Elderly People and the NHS—That the Parliament commends Age Concern on its recently published report Turning Your Back on Us: Older People and the NHS which deals with the serious problem of age discrimination in the National Health Service; believes that medical treatment and care should not be denied or delayed simply on the basis of age; and urges the Scottish Executive to commission an independent investigation to assess whether age discrimination is practised in the National Health Service and to produce an agenda for action if such discrimination exists. Supported by: Mr John McAllion, Bristow Muldoon, Cathy Jamieson, Mr Jamie Stone, Tommy Sheridan, Elaine Smith, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-527 Elderly People and the NHS (lodged on 9 February 2000) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-527 Elderly People and the NHS (lodged on 9 February 2000) Dr Elaine Murray*

S1M-527 Trish Godman: Elderly People and the NHS—That the Parliament commends Age Concern on its recently published report Turning Your Back on Us: Older People and the NHS which deals with the serious problem of age discrimination in the National Health Service; believes that medical treatment and care should not be denied or delayed simply on the basis of age; and urges the Scottish Executive to commission an independent investigation to assess whether age discrimination is practised in the National Health Service and to produce an agenda for action if such discrimination exists. Supported by: Mr John McAllion, Bristow Muldoon, Cathy Jamieson, Mr Jamie Stone, Tommy Sheridan, Elaine Smith, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Dr Elaine Murray
S1M-527 Elderly People and the NHS (lodged on 9 February 2000) Christine Grahame*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-527 Elderly People and the NHS (lodged on 9 February 2000) Cathy Peattie*

S1M-527 Trish Godman: Elderly People and the NHS—That the Parliament commends Age Concern on its recently published report Turning Your Back on Us: Older People and the NHS which deals with the serious problem of age discrimination in the National Health Service; believes that medical treatment and care should not be denied or delayed simply on the basis of age; and urges the Scottish Executive to commission an independent investigation to assess whether age discrimination is practised in the National Health Service and to produce an agenda for action if such discrimination exists.
